intro: Melianthus comosus, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its pinnate leaves and showy, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Melianthus comosus is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some regions.
